workflow.name: Weekly gratitude pulse: Automated appreciation DMs for Slack & Discord communities
workflow.description:
## Weekly Gratitude Pulse: Automated Appreciation DMs for Slack & Discord Communities

Foster belonging with a **weekly, automated appreciation message** sent directly to members who engaged in your **Slack or Discord community**. The **Weekly Gratitude Pulse** **runs every Sunday at 6 PM**, quietly recognizing presence ‚Äî not performance ‚Äî with a warm, personalized DM that says: *‚ÄúYou showed up. We see you. Thank you.‚Äù*

No manual tracking. No public callouts. Just gentle, scalable care.

Perfect for coaches, Etsy sellers, and solopreneurs who want to nurture emotional safety and connection ‚Äî **without adding to their workload.**

---

## üõ†Ô∏è Step-by-Step Setup Instructions

Deploy this workflow in under 10 minutes.

### 1. **Import the Workflow**
- Go to **Scenarios > Import from File**
- Upload the provided JSON template

### 2. **Set the Weekly Schedule**
- Find the **Schedule Trigger** node
- Set to:
  - **Day**: Sunday
  - **Time**: 6:00 PM
  - Adjust **timezone** to match your audience

### 3. **Connect Your Messaging Platform**

#### For Slack:
- Use **Slack ‚Üí List Conversations** or **HTTP Request** to get channel messages
- Replace `{{SLACK_BOT_TOKEN}}` with a token that has:
  - `channels:history`
  - `users:read`
  - `im:write` (for DMs)
- Set `{{SLACK_CHANNEL_ID}}` (e.g., your main community channel)

#### For Discord:
- Use **Discord Bot** with:
  - `Read Message History`
  - `Send Messages`
  - `Create DM`
- Set `{{DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN}}` and `{{GUILD_ID}}`

> üîó Guide: [Slack API Permissions](https://api.slack.com/scopes) | [Discord Bot Setup](https://discord.com/developers/applications)

### 4. **Pull Active Users**
- The workflow pulls all users who:
  - Posted a message
  - Reacted to a message
- Filters out bots and duplicates

### 5. **Send Personalized DMs**
Uses a templated message like:

> ‚ÄúHey {{Name}},  
> Just wanted to say ‚Äî I noticed you were around this week, and I‚Äôm so glad you were.  
> You‚Äôre part of what makes this space feel like home. üíõ  
> Rest well, and I‚Äôll see you in the week ahead.  
> ‚Äî [Your Name]‚Äù

Customize the message in the **Set Message** node.

### 6. **Log in Airtable (Optional)**
- Each sent DM is logged in Airtable for reflection
- Never for surveillance ‚Äî for gratitude auditing

---

## üóÉÔ∏è Airtable Structure

### Base: `Community Wellness Tracker`  
#### Table: `Gratitude Logs`

| Field | Type | Description |
|------|------|-------------|
| `Date Sent` | Date | When the DM was sent |
| `User ID` | Text | Slack/Discord user ID |
| `Username` | Text | Display name (e.g., `@alex`) |
| `Engagement Type` | Multi-select | `Message`, `Reaction`, `Thread Reply` |
| `Message Preview` | Text | First 50 characters of their post |
| `Gratitude Sent` | Checkbox | `true` after DM sent |
| `Channel` | Text | Source channel (e.g., `#general`) |

> üìä Use a **Monthly View** to reflect on community rhythm ‚Äî not to rank, but to honor.

---

## üîÑ Workflow Explanation

The **Weekly Gratitude Pulse** runs a thoughtful, automated cycle:

1. **Trigger**: Fires every **Sunday at 6:00 PM**
2. **Fetch Messages**: Pulls all messages from the past 7 days
3. **Extract Users**: Gathers IDs of users who posted or reacted
4. **De-duplicate & Filter**: Removes bots and duplicates
5. **Personalize Message**: Injects first name or username
6. **Send DM**: Direct message via Slack/DM or Discord/DM
7. **Log in Airtable**: Records the gesture for reflection

üîÅ This creates a **culture of quiet recognition** ‚Äî where showing up is enough.

---

## üì¶ Pre-Conditions & Requirements

- ‚úÖ **Make.com or n8n account** (Free tier supported)
- ‚úÖ **Slack Bot Token** with scopes:
  - `channels:history`, `users:read`, `im:write`
- **OR** **Discord Bot** with:
  - `Read Message History`, `Send Messages`, `Create DM`
- ‚úÖ **Airtable base** with `Gratitude Logs` table
- ‚úÖ Internet access and JSON parsing

> ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: Slack DMs require resolving user ‚Üí IM channel via `conversations.open`. Discord requires `users.get` and `channels.create` for DMs.

---

## üé® Customization Guidance

Make it your own:

### üéØ Change the Message Tone
- Use warm, coach-like, or playful tones
- Add emojis: üí§ ü´∂ üå∏ ‚òï

### üß© Adjust Engagement Criteria
- Only send to those who posted (not just reacted)
- Exclude certain channels (e.g., announcements)

### üìÜ Change Frequency
- Bi-weekly? Edit the schedule.
- Monthly ‚ÄúBig Thank You‚Äù? Add a filter for high engagement.

### üíå Add a Small Gift
- Auto-send a **discount code** or **freebie link** in the DM
- Use **Google Sheets** or **Shopify** to generate unique codes

### üìà Combine with Hydration Hug
- Use the same Airtable base
- Create a **‚ÄúCare Score‚Äù** view: Hydration reactions + Gratitude receipts

---

## üåê Who It‚Äôs For

- **Coaches & Facilitators** who want to deepen trust
- **Etsy Sellers** with VIP customer groups
- **Wellness Creators** building mindful spaces
- **Community Managers** reducing burnout

This isn‚Äôt engagement farming.  
It‚Äôs **digital hospitality** ‚Äî automation with a heartbeat.

nodes.name: Every Sunday at 6 PM
nodes.notes:
üïí Weekly Trigger

Fires every Sunday at 6:00 PM.

üîπ Adjust timezone in Make/n8n settings.

This is the heartbeat of the gratitude cycle.

nodes.name: Get Slack Channel Messages
nodes.notes:
üì• Fetch Last 7 Days of Messages

Pulls all messages from the community channel.

üîß Requires:
- SLACK_BOT_TOKEN
- SLACK_CHANNEL_ID

Used to identify active members.

nodes.name: Extract Active Users
nodes.notes:
üë• Extract Unique User IDs

Finds all users who:
- Posted a message
- Added a reaction

Filters out bots and duplicates.

Output: List of user IDs for DMs.

nodes.name: Get User Info
nodes.notes:
üè∑Ô∏è Get Username & Profile

Resolves user ID to:
- Display name
- Real name (optional)

Used to personalize the DM.

nodes.name: Open DM Channel
nodes.notes:
üì® Open Direct Message Channel

Creates a 1:1 DM channel between bot and user.

Required before sending private messages in Slack.

nodes.name: Send Gratitude DM
nodes.notes:
üíå Send Personalized DM

Warm, no-pressure message of appreciation.

üí° Customize the text to match your voice.

Never demands a response ‚Äî just honors presence.

nodes.name: Log in Airtable
nodes.notes:
üìä Log Sent Gratitude

Records the gesture in Airtable for reflection.

Not for tracking ‚Äî for honoring.

Use to see patterns, not pressure.

user.name: Shelly-Ann Davy
user.bio:

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)
